channel.title: Npc auto spwan?
channel.description: how do i auto spwan npc?? what files thanks for any1 that helps ;)

item.title: Npc auto spwan?
item.dc:creator: @daved daved
item.description:
@daved wrote:

I realized that before you made the post… anyways, I’m tired, it was a Christmas party at my house so I’m kinda exhausted.

I need to wait for my owner to get online so I can give him what I coded so far so I’m going to explain you what you need to do to make a new npc spawn in the server.

You will see something like this:

spawn = 1597	2604	3098	0	2604	3100	2602	3097	1       Vannaka

You need to start with ‘spawn =’ because that’s how this things work.

1597 represents the id of the monster, you can find ids by going to moparscape client looking for help > npc list
2604 3098 represent the coords of the npc spawned. You can get coords by typing ::mypos (317 servers) in-game

0 is the orientation, you can modify that so the npc will face east west north or south.

2604 3100 2602 3097 this coords will get the npc moving, if you notice i changed the coords + - 1
I’m not sure what the 1 is for, but I know it is always there so don’t change it.

Note, if you don’t want the npc to move, leave the coords at the end 0. like this:

spawn = 1597	2604	3098	0	0	0	0	0	1       Vannaka

Read full topic

item.title: Npc auto spwan?
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

[quote=“daved, post:2, topic:321957”]ok, go to your source dir.

Find config file
And then look for autospawn.class.cfg

You will see there a lot of ids which represent coords ids of npcs orientation and stuff like that… Hope i helped :)[/quote]

Read full topic
